wikipedia_page.main: Lieutenant-Commander John Bridge,  (5 February 1915 – 14 December 2006) was a British bomb disposal expert of the Royal Navy Volunteer Reserve during the Second World War and a recipient of the George Cross. He was the first person to be awarded a Bar to the George Medal.

response: *John Bridge, 91, British recipient of the George Cross and George Medal, natural causes.
* 14 December – John Bridge, World War II sailor (born 1915)
* John Bridge, the first person to be awarded a bar to the George Medal was a teacher at the school before and after the Second World War
* 5 February – John Bridge, World War II sailor (died 2006)

Hugh Randall Syme,  (20 February 1903 – 7 November 1965) was an Australian naval officer, bomb disposal operative, and newspaper proprietor. He was awarded the George Cross for his actions in defusing unexploded bombs and landmines during the Second World War. Syme is one of only two people to be awarded the George Cross, George Medal, and Bar, the other being John Bridge.
